msContents.summary: Of Text A, very little can be said. Texts B and C both contain many personal names, often of deceased people, but specify little property, apart from some slaves (ἀνδράποδα). Both texts mention a deceased Patrophilos, obviously the man known from many Petra texts as the son of Bassos and uncle of Theodoros, son of Obodianos.

msItemStruct.note: Three texts written transversa charta separated by empty spaces of ca. 20 cm. They were all evidently written by the same small vertical hand. Right margin extant (1-1.5 cm).
